With the 20,000 KES she wants to purchase wheat flour, cashew nuts, sugar and cooking oil for her business. Miriam joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, cashew nuts, sugar and cooking oil for her business

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.en:
Laxmi is 25 years old. She is married and has one child, aged 2. Many years ago, she established  her goat-raising business. Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family.  

She has already received and successfully repaid four loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy baby goats. In the future, Laxmi plans to uplift the economic conditions of her family.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy baby goats

loans.name: Durga Maa Group

texts.en:
Ganga is the leader of a group that hails from Kotapeta village of Rayagada district of Odisha, India. She is a married woman of 44 years of age. The member standing at the middle with raised hand is Ganga. 

She is managing a business of leaf plate-making and selling in her locality. Her husband is doing a seasonal business. Ganga has a family of five members consisting of her husband and three children about 18, 12 and 8 years old.
 
Ganga, along with four other members of her village, formed a group and applied for a loan from Mahashakti Foundation for expansion of their existing businesses. It is the first time the group will take a loan from MSF.

Out of their small incomes they are maintaining their families in a low profile. At present, her monthly income is Rs.5,000 but still it is not sufficient to meet the needs of her family. After learning the business procedure and knowledge, she wants to increase the volume of her business. Now she wants a loan to purchase leaf plates for stitching and wholesaling also.

In future, she wants to establish a grocery shop in her village.
  
The other members are Waralaxmi, Parvati, Dhanalaxmi and Goureswari and they want loans for leaf plate-making, tailoring, grocery shop and leaf plate wholesaling, respectively.

loans.use: to purchase leaf plates for stitching and wholesaling.

loans.name: Yatta

texts.en:
Yatta lives in Montserrado County, the capital city of Liberia that is well-known as the commercial city of Liberia. She 27 years old, and she is single with two children, aged 3 and 10 years old, who are in school and live at home. 

For the past four years, she has been selling used clothes in the community market. She started this business with the help from her susu (a local savings account) and learned this way of selling from her mother. She spends eight hours each day on her business, and she uses a taxi most of the time to get her goods to her table. She is requesting a loan to buy more used clothes to expand her sales. She wants to get more money and live a good life.

loans.use: to buy more used clothes to expand her sales.

loans.name: Aletha

texts.en:
Aletha lives in Sinkor. She is 40 years old, and she is single with six children between 3 and 20 years old. Only five of her children are in school, and they all live at home. 

For the past three years, she has been selling charcoal in the local market. She sells from Monday to Saturday, spending 10 hours on her business. She started this business with money given to her by her children's father, and learned this way of selling from her mother.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business. Her plan is to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 22-year-old single young man from Gaza City. He lives with his family in a small simple house in the city. Ali's father works as a fisherman earning an unstable income. This is the family's only source of income. Ali is a student in a local university where he studies elementary education. He is a very clever student. He would like to complete his studies and find a job as a teacher to help his spouse. 

Ali took a 600 USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Ali will be able to do his homework and write reports easily. Ali appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 33 years old. She has been selling different items in her boutique, but with this loan she wants to buy more batteries, biscuits and cooking oil to sell. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings for a better future.

loans.use: To buy more batteries, biscuits and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is running a shop that sells many types of cold drinks such as beer, stout, soft drinks, etc. He also sells rice, toothpaste, bath and washing soap, and hair grease, among other materials in the area of New Kru Town; a well-known early community of Liberia. He has been running this business for the past 20 years now. He makes substantial profits and has many customers. He uses his profits for rent, schooling, and other expenses. 

He started this business with money that he saved. He has four children between 4 and 13 years old that are in school and live at home. He is requesting a loan to purchase more of the type of goods he sells at his business. John is 42 years old, and he is a 6th grade dropout. He plans to educate his children, and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more drinks, rice, toothpaste, soap, etc. for his business.

loans.name: Bertrand

texts.en: Bertrand is a 38-year-old Cameroonian who is married with seven children. His oldest child is seventeen and is in secondary school, while his youngest is six months old. He has been in the fruit selling business for over fifteen years, which makes him very experienced and stable. His business is likely to succeed because it is located in an urban area with many potential customers.This loan will increase his turnover by twenty percent and his standard of living will improve as a result.

loans.use: to buy fruit in large quantities to resell.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a businesswoman who is very hardworking. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She is a widowed woman and a mother of seven children.

Fatuma has operated a firewood selling business for the past 20 years. Her potential clients are neighbours and passersby. She also sells palm leaves 

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase bundles of firewood and palm leaves for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of firewood and palm leaves for resale.

loans.name: Gerifati

texts.en:
Gerafati is gratefull to the Kiva lenders for the funding they gave him previously. His output increased with the fertilized land and so did his income.
He is a farmer who grows bananas on a large scale. He works four days in a week and eight hours in a day. He started farming in 1998. He supplements his agriculture business with a produce business that enables him to earn extra.

Gerafati usually sells his output in trading centres nearby and to other traders from Kampala city. He hopes to use this loan to boost his agricultural business and also has a dream of becoming the region's leading producer of matooke, a starchy banana often used in cooking.

He has some challenges in his work like drought seasons, which affect the output, as well as the unstable prices of agricultural products. He is described as a hardworking and honest man.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for his banana plants.

loans.name: Keyling Fabiola

texts.es: Keyling Fabiola tiene 21 años de edad, originaria de la ciudad de León. Es una joven soltera, estudia en una de las universidades de la ciudad. Ella a pesar de su nivel económico ha salido adelante con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación, ha cumplido las metas propuestas  y se siente orgullosa de lo que ha logrado hoy en día. Su familia la apoya de igual manera, su Mama quiere y desea que su hija sea una excelente profesional y se siente orgullosa de su hija y de lo que ha logrado. Solicita el crédito para poder pagar sus módulos y así lograr obtener su título profesional. Su plan futuro es conseguir un empleo en donde pueda aplicar sus conocimientos adquiridos.
texts.en: Keyling Fabiola is 21 years old and originally from the city of León. She is single and studying at one of the city's universities. Despite her financial situation, Keyling has gotten ahead with a lot of effort and dedication. She has achieved her goals and is proud of what she has done up to now. Keyling's family supports her; her mother wants her daughter to be a great professional and she is proud of her and what she has achieved. Keyling is applying for this loan in order to pay for her modules so as to then receive her degree certificate. Keyling's plan for the future is to find a job where she can apply the knowledge she has gained.

loans.use: to pay for her modules so as to then receive her degree certificate.

loans.name: Maa Santoshi Group

texts.en:
Sandhyarani is a 44-year-old lady who lives in a small town named Kolnara in the Rayagada district, Odisha, India. She is the leader of a four-member group. Her family comprises her husband and a son of about 24 years of age. The woman standing second from left with raised hand is Sandhyarani. 

At present she is doing a milk business in her locality. She has a cow. Her husband is also supporting her in taking care of the cow and marketing the milk. She is a very active lady who wants some extra income with her own efforts. Her family income is about Rs.6,000 per month, which is not sufficient to maintain her family.
 
It is the first time the group will avail a loan from MSF. From the loan she will purchase a Jersey cow. 
 
Of the other three members of the group, two, named Jayanti and Panala, want a loan for a milk business, and Rukuna wants a loan for a grocery shop.

loans.use: to purchase a Jersey cow.

loans.name: Godfred

texts.en:
Ghanaian artisan Godfred specializes in hand-carved African masks. He would like to invest in the purchase of wood, metal plates and sandpaper for production.

Godfred has been selling through NOVICA since 2010. This is his story:

"As a child, I used to make boats with worn-out metal utensils, which I'd float in water. Due to financial constraints, my parents could not further my education and so I had to drop out of school and join my uncle, who was a wood carver. Thanks to the woodcarving, I've been able to educate my four children and I know that with constant sales, I'll be able to give them a brighter future than I had. This motivates me to wake up each day to carve!

"I really do not know where I would be now if it wasn't for the support I have been receiving from you through your contributors to this microcredit. I thank you so much."

Use the link below to view Godfred's hand-carved wood masks on the NOVICA site: www.novica.com/kiva/7252

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of wood, metal plates and sandpaper for production.

loans.name: Mousa

texts.en: Mousa is a 20-year-old single man from Gaza city. He lives with his family in a small, simple, house in the city. Mousa's father works as an employee in the public sector, where he receives a low income. That is the only source of income for the family. Mousa is a student at a local university, where he studies agricultural and environmental science. He is very clever student, and he would like to complete his studies and find a job to help his family. Mousa took out a loan from FATEN, which will help him to buy a new laptop to use in his studies. Because of this loan, Mousa will be able to do his assignments and write his reports easily.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna is 43 years old, and she lives in Vanadzor city in the Lori region. She is married and has two pretty daughters. Anna works at a preschool educational institution as a mentor. She is very active and kind person, and she loves the children very much. She organizes a variety of interesting and cheerful morning performances, and she teaches the children nice poems, painting, singing and various development games. She also has a nice hobby--she does needlework. Thanks to her original designs and great imagination, she makes masterpieces with needle and thread, and she manages to sells her work to various shops and to fill private orders. Anna is applying for a loan of 300,000 Armenian drams in order to buy a computer, which will help her to learn more about needlework. She plans to advertise her work on the Internet and get more orders.

loans.use: to buy a computer, which will help her to learn more about needlework and advertise her work.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Annah is married and has six children who attend school.  She is a farmer in a village cell and she rears and sells cows, which she has been doing since 1998.  In addition to her trade in cows, she also grows and sells tea for additional income. Her major reason for starting the business was to earn money to support her family. 

Annah is requesting a loan from UGAFODE for 4,000,000 UGX, which she will use to buy grazing land for her cattle, allowing them feed well and therefore increase output so Annah earns more profits. On the same land, she will put a house for her family. Her major challenge is competition but she is hopeful that it will no longer be a challenge if she receives the loan. Annah is also challenged by lack of enough capital but she hopes that this will not be a challenge any more. 

Annah describes herself as an honest lady and believes that her honesty is what has helped her survive in business. She is hopeful that she will get her dream in life to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase grazing land

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en: Svetlana and her family live in Kapan city in Syunik region. Svetlana graduated from Yerevan State University, and now she works at the local school as a teacher of Russian Language and Literature. Svetlana is married, and she has a son, who is now doing his military service in the army, and a daughter who works at a bank as a loan specialist. Her husband is also employed and, in addition to their jobs, the whole family is engaged in farming activities, where they help each other. At the nearby village of Tandzaver, they have a nice, cute, farm, where they are raising ten piglets and maintain twenty beehives. They sell meat and very tasty honey from their farm. Svetlana would very much like to increase the number of beehives. Svetlana is applying for a loan of 900,000 Armenian drams in order to buy fodder for their piglets and also several beehives.

loans.use: to buy several new beehives and fodder for their piglets

loans.name: Taguhi

texts.en:
Taguhi is 55 years old and lives in the village of Lchashen in the Gegharkunik region. Taguhi has graduated from Pedagogical College and from her graduation till now, already 31 years, she has worked at the local school. Taguhi is married and has a son and a daughter; both of them are married and they live separately with their families. Taguhi’s husband is also employed, but he also together with his wife is engaged in farming and they do it with great pleasure. In their farm they have four cows, three bulls, three piglets, five sheep and fifty chickens. All of their farm products (meat, milk and eggs) they sell to their loyal customers from their house.
Taguhi asks for a loan of 1,100,000 Armenian drams (AMD) in order to become more specialized in swine breeding and to buy several piglets.

loans.use: to become more specialized in swine breeding and to buy several piglets

loans.name: Kamo

texts.en:
Kamo is already taking his second loan from Kiva. He lives in the village of Tandzaver in the Sunikskiy region with his wife and his son. His daughter is married and she lives with her family. Kamo’s son has already graduated from college and he now greatly helps his father in farming. Kamo together with farming simultaneously works as forester and at the television station as a man of duty. Kamo owns a plot of land where he grows mainly fruits and vegetables. He also breeds large horned cattle and chickens. Kamo’s wife now is unemployed, but she used to work as a librarian at their village and she also helped her husband to sell vegetables and fruit of their farm, but now she has problems connected with her heart and the doctor directed urgent heart surgery.

Kamo asks a loan of 1,100,000 Armenian drams (AMD) in order to pay for his wife’s heart operation.

loans.use: to pay for his wife’s heart heart operation fees

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana is a Ghanaian artisan who specializes in hand-carved décor items. Nana is the chief carver for the king of the Ashanti. He would like to invest in the purchase of wood and polish for production.

Nana has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is his story:

"I draw inspiration from traditional kente cloth designs, from my family background, and from our rich Ashanti tradition. Some of my work for the king includes objects with "gye nyame" (a symbol for the supremacy of God), stools, staffs and other royal and ceremonial objects. My dream has always been to invest in my children's education. I am happy to say that this is now possible.

"My family and I will always be grateful to all the contributors to my microcredit."

Use the link below to view Nana's wood carvings on the NOVICA site: www.novica.com/kiva/1482

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of wood and polish for production.

loans.name: Makvala

texts.en:
Makvala is a 60-year-old lady who lives in the Chiatura district with her husband and a grown daughter. The only breadwinner in the household is Makvala’s husband, who works as an engine-driver at the local mining company. 

In order to generate income and meet her household expenses, Makvala plans to start a small bakery where Khachapuri (traditional Georgian cheese pie) will be baked. Makvala is an experienced baker and used to work in that business for years. Makvala will bake pies herself and work hard all day long to generate income.

She will start the business in a hired commercial space. The location is great and Makvala hopes that this initiative will be lucrative. With the loan, she will buy an oven and all of the equipment necessary for baking. Her husband and daughter will help her to run the business. Makvala awaits your support.

loans.use: to start up a Khachapuri (Georgian cheese pie) bakery

loans.name: Walterson D.

texts.en:
Walterson D. is running an internet cafe in the area of New Kru Town, one of Liberia's will known early communities. He has been running this business, providing services and computer training to many people in the surrounding communities for the past 10 years now. He makes substantial profits, because he is the only one who runs an internet cafe that also provides computer training to Liberians. He is challenged by lack of enough capital to improve his cafe's browsing speed. 

He started this business by working in information technology. He has a 14-year-old child that is in school and lives at home. He is requesting a loan to purchase more computers and provide better services to his customers. Walterson D. is 30 years old, and a high school graduate. He plans to build a better home, and educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase more computers and provide better services to his customers.

loans.name: Eloctwkwa Francis.

texts.en: Eloctwkwa Francis is 35 years old and lives in New Kru Town, an established and well-known town in Liberia. He is married and he is a high school graduate. He has a two-year-old child who stays at home. For the last year, he has been selling stout, beer, and other alcoholic drinks from a shop in his community. He makes lots of profits, since he is the only one who is involved in this business in his community. A problem he is facing is his low income. He is applying  for a loan to buy more stout, beer, and other alcoholic drinks for his business. He plan is to build a decent house and educate his children. He wants to thank all the lenders of BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to buy more stout, beer, and other alcoholic drinks for his business.

loans.name: Sani

texts.en:
Sani is 38-years-old.  She is married and has two children aged 21 and 17.  Many years ago, she established  her cow raising business.  Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy a milk giving cow.  In the future, Sani plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.

Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal.  Cows are never raised for beef, but for their milk from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made.  Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking.  On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk each day.  In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about USD $0.50.  

In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction, as fuel for fires, and can be captured in methane storage tanks.  The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over.

loans.use: to buy a young cow

loans.name: Diana Maritza

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito 20 De Abril se reúne cada 15 días en el Cantón Montecristi  conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Diana, tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de  15 y 13 años que estudian en colegio. Su esposo trabaja en una empresa en Manta.
Doña Diana es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto  ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos que generan los estudios de sus hijos se dedica a la venta de zapatos por catalogo y productos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Ella sale a recorrer por la localidad  casi todas las mañanas visitando a sus clientes habituales ya sea para cobrar los productos que deja a crédito o ofreciendo nuevos productos. Tiene 7  años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual lucha para darles la mejor educación a sus hijos.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y zapatos. Lleva más de 4 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son de mucha ayuda para ella. Su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The credit group 20 de Abril (April 20th) meets every 15 days in the Montecristi neighborhood, known for its rich precolonial culture and for its handicrafts which are known nationally and internationally. It is also known for making the famous broad-brimmed straw hats. 

This is where Diana lives.  She is 33 years old, married and has two children from this relationship.  They are 15 and 13 years old and are in high school. Her husband works for a company in Manta.  Diana is a housewife but sells shoes from a catalog as well as Avon (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and accessories for women) so that she can have some money of her own and help her husband with the expenses for her children's education. Almost every morning she travels through her neighborhood visiting her regular customers either to collect payment for the products she has sold on credit or to offer new products. She has been doing this for seven years, fighting to provide her children with the best education possible. 

This loan is to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and shoes.  She has been with the credit group for four years and she likes it because the loans are very helpful to her.  Her dream is for her children to become professionals.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and shoes.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa appreciates her previous Kiva loan, which improved her living standards.

She still operates a food stall business. She is requesting for a loan of KES 20,000 to purchase cooking oil, onions, tomatoes, charcoal, wheat flour, and beans for resale. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, onions, tomatoes, charcoal, wheat flour, and beans for resale.

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en:
Stanley is a second-time borrower applying for 2,000,000 UGX. He is a single father of one child that he stays with in a one-room house he rents in the outskirts of the city. For survival, Stanley drives a special hire taxi that belongs to his boss. It is this money he gets from the special hire taxi that has helped him acquire a piece of land and service his previous loan with ease and with no delays. 

Stanley has one major challenge of staying in a rented house. To fight this problem, he has embarked on constructing a simple residential house that is now at the foundation stage as seen in the photo. Now that he wants to put the house at a further stage, he has again opted for another loan to see it at another stage that is at least at the beam level. He is so fed up with pressure from his landlord and he hopes to be able to complete the house soon and occupy it.

loans.use: To buy building materials for his house.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en: Annah is a business woman in Kizinda where her drug shop business is located.  She is a mother of four children and she is 42-years-old. She started the business in the year 1994 with an objective of making income so that she could pay school fees for all her children.  She also has a butchery in addition to the drug shop business and she says this helps her a lot since it gives her additional income which she uses to cater to the needs of the family. Her clients are people around Ishaka who go to her to buy drugs for their sick relatives.  Her main challenge is competition since there are several drug shops in the same area where she operates from but she believes that if she is given a loan of 3,000,000 UGX she will restock the drug shop and will out compete her competitors. Her future hopes include establishing other drug shop outlets so that she makes more sales and earns more profits.

loans.use: To buy medicine

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 23-year-old single young man from Gaza city. He lives with his family in a small, simple, house in the city. Mohammad's father works as an employee in the public sector, where he receives a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. Mohammad is a student at a local university, where he studies accounting. He is very clever student, and he would like to complete his studies and find a job to help his family. Mohammad took out a loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. This loan will help Mohammad do his assignments and write his reports easily.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria lives in Sinkor. She is 27 years old, single, and a 6th grade dropout. For the past 20 years she has been selling fish in the local market. A challenge she faces is the rainy season. She started this business with money from her mother. She says handling her own money makes her happy about her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish for her business. She wants to expand her business to a shop business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for her business.

loans.name: Teta

texts.en:
Teta lives at Sinkor, the capital city of Liberia, in Montserrado County. It is well known as the commercial city of Liberia. Teta is 45 years old and single with 4 children between 13 and 30 years old. Only two of her children attend school. For the past 8 years now she has been running a table market where she sells oil, pepper, rice, etc. for her business. 

She started this business with money from her friends and learned this way of selling from them. She likes her business, because it allows her to earn profit and makes her popular. She is requesting a loan to buy more cooking oil, pepper, rice, etc. for her business. She wants to earn more money to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more oil, pepper, rice, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Louise

texts.en:
Louise lives in Sinkor.  She is 33 years old and married, with two children, ages 7 and 11, both in school and living at home. She is a 12th grade graduate. 

For the past six years she has been selling rice, palm oil, pepper, vita, fish, etc., in the local market. What really worries her is that she has less income to meet customers' demand. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, palm oil, pepper, vita, fish, and others items to expand her business.  She started this business with a little money which she received from her husband, and she learned this way of selling from her friends. 

She enjoys the flow of her customers, and having money in her home makes her proud. Her wish is to live better lives in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more rice, palm oil, pepper, vita, fish, and others items to expand her business,

loans.name: La Foi De Aculesamedi Group

texts.fr:
Delima est le coordinateur de son groupe La Foi de Aculesamedi. Il n'est pas mariee. Il habite dans la region nord est d`Haïti ou de électricité est rare et de Léau portable est très limité.

Il dirige son commerce de vente de du charbon pendants les 9 derniers années. Avant de ce commercé ce commerce Il était enseignant. Il espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à grandir son commerce.

Des autres membres de La Foi de Aculesamedi ont besoin d'un emprunt pour le commerce tel que ventes produits cosmétiques, boissons gazeuses, produit alimentaires, charbon, etc. Il dit que son défit principal est de devenir un plus grand commerçant

Il dit son but principal c’est d’avoir une plus grande commerce qui lui facilitera à voyagé dans des autre pays tel que panama.
texts.en:
Delima is the coordinator of the La Foi de Aculesamedi Group. He is not married. He lives in the north of Haitia, where electricity is rare and access to drinking water very limited. He has been running a business selling charcoal for the last nine years. Before going into this business, he used to be a teacher. He hopes that this loan will allow him to grow his business. 

Other members of the La Foi de Aculesamedi group need loans for their business such as selling cosmetics, soft drinks, food items, charcoal etc. Delima says that his biggest challenge is to increase his sales volume. His main goal is to expand his business, which will allow him to travel to other countries, such as Panama.

loans.use: to buy firewood.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca lives in Sinkor in Montserrado County, the capital city of Liberia.  It is well known as the commercial city of Liberia. She is 43-years-old and married to a teacher. They have five children between the ages of 19 and 28, who are in school and live at home. Over the past seven years now, she has been running a table where she sells fish.  She started this business with help from her husband and learned this way of selling from her mother.  She likes her business because it makes more profits and it makes her popular. She is requesting a loan to buy more fish for her business. She wants to build her house.

loans.use: to buy more fish for her business.

loans.name: Gormah

texts.en:
Gormah lives in Sinkor. She is 32 years old, unmarried, and has two children, ages 11 and 15 years old, who live at home and are in school. 

For seven years now, Gormah has been selling batteries, soap, copy book, etc. She started this business from her savings. She makes lots of profit and has more customers, which makes her happy about her business. 

Gormah is requesting a loan to purchase more batteries, soap, copy book, etc. for her business. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more batteries, soap, copy book, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
Mamie is 45 years old. Mamie and her fiancee live in Congo Town, Montserrado County, which has the largest port and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. Her fiancee is a carpenter and they have four children between the ages of 13 and 26. Only one of them attends school and two of them live at home. 

Since 2010, Mamie has been selling used clothes in her community market, but presently, she is selling fried fish, plantains, sweet potatoes, doughnuts, etc. Sometimes, she has less customers, but most of the time, she makes a lot of money.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish, plantains, potatoes, flour, etc. for her business. 

In the future, Mamie plans to send her children to school, until they finish college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish, plantains, potatoes, flour, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Marquita

texts.es:
Marquita, de 24 años de edad, está casada y tiene un hijo de un año de edad con quien vive en su casa propia
Marquita se dedica a la venta de comidas y bebidas, actividad que realiza todos los sábados, domingos y feriados en su local  ubicado en su propia casa, el cual lo abrió ya hace 06 años,  tiempo en el cual le valió para hacerse conocida en la zona y por las personas que pasan por el lugar, contando con la apoyo de su esposo que le ayudan en la  preparación y atención al publico en sus tiempo libre, paralelo a esta actividad también se dedica a la venta de bebidas gaseosas durante los días de la semana contando con una refrigeradora  que compro con sus ahorros. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite tener un ingreso económico, sigue esforzándose  gracias a que su puesto es muy concurrido  teniendo todas las ganas de ampliar su negocio. En esta oportunidad solicitara S/.1200 soles el cual le permite seguir adelante con su negocio.Con el préstamo  comprará materiales de construcción para arreglar su negocio y con el saldo lo invertirá en la compra de los ingredientes necesarios para preparar sus comidas.
texts.en:
Marquita, who is 24 years old, is married and has a one-year-old son who lives with her in her own house. Marquita makes a living selling food and drinks. She does this on Saturdays, Sundays and holidays from her food stall which is in her own house. She opened it 6 years ago and has made the most of this time to make herself well known in the area and by passers by. She has support from her husband who helps her with the preparation and serving customers in his free time. 

As well as this she sells fizzy drinks during the week and has a refrigerator which she bought with her savings. What she likes about her work is that it allows her to have an income. She continues to work hard as her stall is very busy and she really wants to expand her business.

On this occasion she is asking for 1200 soles which will enable her to make progress with her business. She will use the loan to buy building materials to make some improvements to the business and with the rest she will buy the necessary ingredients for preparing her food.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and ingredients such as rice, meat, vegetables and other items.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 40 years old and lives in Montserrado County, which has the largest freeport and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. Esther is married with 8 children that are living on their own. Esther has been selling palm oil, beans, rice, garlic, etc. for the past three years. She says her main challenge is transportation costs. She started this business with money given to her by her husband and she learned this business from her friends. Her favorite part about her business is that it gives her money and it makes her proud that it enables her to take care of their home. Esther is requesting this loan to purchase more palm oil, beans, rice, garlic, etc. to enlarge her business. She hopes to build a house for their family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, beans, rice, garlic, etc. to enlarge her business.

loans.name: Firuz

texts.ru: Фируз бизнесмен, проживающий в городе Истаравшан. Полтора года тому назад он брал кредит для своего бизнеса, для купли фужеров, наборов чашек и сервиза. Он благодарит Кредиторов KIVA за поддержку и сегодня снова обратился за повторным кредитом. Он хочет увеличить ассортимент товара в магазине, чтобы привлечь больше клиентов и таким образом увеличить товарооборот. На сумму кредита Фируз хочет приобрести разнообразный набор посуды и сервиза. Он очень ценит свой бизнес, так как за счет его прибыли он обеспечивает свою семью. Фируз надеется, что и в этот раз его поддержат и он сможет расширить бизнес.
texts.en: Firuz is a businessman living in Istaravshan . Eighteen months ago, he took out a loan to buy wine glasses, cups, and tea services for his business. He is thankful to his Kiva lenders for their support, and is once again asking for a loan. He wants to increase the range of products in his store to attract more customers and thus increase sales. Firuz wants to use the money to buy a variety of dishes and tea services. He values his business since he is able to use the profit he makes to provide for his family. Firuz hopes that you support him this time, and he can expand his business.

loans.use: buy dishes and tea services to increase his sales.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a qualified midwife who decided to open up a drug shop so she could get money to take her children to good schools. She is an old borrower at UGAFODE Microfinance having borrowed five times. She is 46 years old and very determined to carry on her business until she gets her dream in life. 

Beatrice started the business in 1999 and is happy that the business has grown slowly but steadily. She works seven days a week and works 12 hours each day. Beatrice believes that if she gets the loan money, she will re-stock the drug shop. Her drug shop is located in the busiest trading center in Ishaka and she is hopeful that she will make profits from the business. Beatrice would like to buy drugs using the loan money so that she can ably serve her customers who are the patients who come from around Ishaka. 

Her hopes for the future include giving the children quality education so that they can compete favorably with other people on the job market. Her main challenges are the bad debtors who never pay and she says this affects her greatly.

loans.use: To buy drugs

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 37 years old and lives in Montserrado County, which has the largest free-port and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is single with 5 children between 10 and 21 years old, who are attending school and live at home. She has been selling palm oil, rice, pepper, salt, vita, etc. for the past 7 years. She says her main challenge is the transportation cost. Rose started this business with money given to her by her mother and she learned this business from her friends. Her favorite part about her business is it gives her money. What make her proud is that it enables her to take care of children and herself. Rose is requesting this loan to purchase more palm oil, rice, pepper, salt, and vita to expand her sales. She plans to build a house for her children in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, rice, pepper, salt, and vita to expand her sales.

loans.name: Justina

texts.en: Justina is a 55-year-old married woman from Cortes, Bohol. She has been operating a sari-sari store (general store) for more than 20 years now. She sells noodles, rice, canned goods, chips and seasoning to the people in her community. This is her source of income. Justina is applying for a loan worth 25,000 PHP to buy more items to sell like rice, canned goods, noodles, shampoo, candies and cookies. This loan would be a great help for her especially because it will allow her to buy more stock to sell. Justina dreams of expanding her business in the future. She also plans on saving some of her income for future use.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, chips, toiletries and seasoning

loans.name: Lilya

texts.en:
Lilya is 46 years old and lives in Sevan city in the Gegharkunik region. She works as a teacher of geography at the school. Lilya is married and has a son and a daughter. Her son studies at the Yerevan State Pedagogical University at the last course and her daughter studies at the Yerevan State University at the faculty of history; she studies at the paid division. Her husband works at a private company as an expert. Despite the fact that Lilya and her husband are employed and they work very hard, they have some financial problems connected with paying of their daughter’s tuition fee.
She asks a loan of 165,000 Armenian drams (AMD) in order to pay for her daughter’s tuition fee for the first semester.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter’s tuition fee for the first semester

loans.name: Massa

texts.en: Massa is 31 years old and live in New Kru Town, one of the early communities in Liberia which is well-known in Liberia; she is married and has 2 children ages 8 and 10, who are presently in school and live at home. She completed 12th grade before starting her business. Massa has been running a block factory for five years now where she makes and sells blocks. She learned this ways of selling from her friends. Massa is very happy with her business because she makes lot of profits. She is requesting a loan to buy more cement, sand, and water to increase her business volume. Her plans are to expand her business and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more cement, sand, and water to increase her business volume.

loans.name: Watta

texts.en: Watta lives in Montserrado County, the county of the capital city of Liberia which is well known as the commercial city of Liberia. She is 42 years old and married with three children between 14 and 22 years old; only one is in school and lives at home. Since 2007 she has been selling rubber dishes in the local market. She started this business with money from her husband and learned this way of selling from her mother. She spends eight hours a day in her business, and most of the time she uses the bus to get her goods to her shop. She enjoys her business because of the profit she makes every day. She is requesting her 5th loan to buy more rubber dishes (bowls, cups, plates, tubs etc) for her business. In the near future, she wants to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to buy more rubber dishes (bowls, cups, plates, tubs, etc) for her business.

loans.name: Sidonie

texts.en:
Sidonie is a 36-year-old single woman with a 10-year-old child who is in primary school. For the past four years, she has run a food stall in Cameroon. Sidonie is very stable and experienced and her business is likely to succeed because it is located in an urban area with many potential customers.

Sidonie is requesting a loan to buy pork to cook and sell. Her loan will increase her profit by fifty percent. Sidonie hopes to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy pork to cook and sell

loans.name: Osman    K

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone!  This is 33-year-old Osman, who is from the Tombo Eastern rural area in Freetown. He is married, with three children between the ages of 2 years and 9 years. 

Osman runs a fuel business.  He sells fuel at a particular business place. He has been running this business since 2007. He works at the business every day, from morning to night. Osman says that the main challenge to his business is sometimes the scarcity of fuel.

Osman has requested a loan in order to purchase more gallons of fuel for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow him to increase his business and improve his family's status of living. 

In the future, he plans to open a big fuel station. He thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more fuel for resale.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is 33 years old and Tomas, her husband, is 35.  They have two children: Lucia who is 3 years old and Alonso who is 5.  They live in a small indigenous community in the San Juan Cancun municipality of Chiapas state, in a one-room wood house with a tin roof and no bathroom or any services.  They use wood to cook.  They would like to have this loan for their housing. The family in this moment doesn't have their own house. They live in Juana's parents' house where they help with a little store. They would like to have their own house and live in peace without living overcrowded in their parents' house.  This would give them a lot of happiness to feel independent and to overcome.

To buy stock for the store, Tomas has to go out to the nearest city, which is two hours away.  When Juana is not in the store, she likes textile weaving and she sells them in the city the day the governmental program gives money.  She also cares for her coffee plot, works in the kitchen, and takes care of their children.  Even though their children are still little, they wish them to go to school, but the school is 30 minutes walking as there’s no transportation. 

Habitat for Humanity is a nonprofit international organization founded on the conviction that every man, woman and child should have a decent, safe, and affordable place to live.  Habitat for Humanity Mexico works in communities with groups who build through mutual help and a self-construction system.  The families need to participate in workshops and trainings about building, healthy housing, and financial education in order to develop and strengthen their capacities.  Habitat for Humanity has been working in Mexico since 1989 and has served more than 7,000 families just in the last 3 years.

loans.use: to buy materials to build a house

loans.name: Graciela Leonor

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito 20 De Abril se reúne cada 15 días en el Cantón Montecristi  conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Graciela, tiene 30 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos de 12, 7, 4 y 3 años de edad, los dos mayores estudian en escuela. El marido es ebanista. 
Doña Graciela realiza el crédito para que su esposo lo utilice en su negocio, el tiene un taller de ebanistería  en su casa, allí el realiza muchos trabajos a base de madera como muebles, sillas, puertas, camas, entre otros productos, trabaja de lunes a sábado desde las 8h00 hasta las 17h00. Realiza trabajos para personas que llegan hasta su establecimiento y también entrega en Manta y Portoviejo en algunos  almacenes de esas ciudades. La madera la compra en un depósito de madera en Manta donde encuentra la madera que necesita para elaborar obras de muy buena calidad.
Este crédito lo van a emplear para comprar madera, pintura, selladores y otros materiales para la elaboración de sus obras. Está en el Grupo De Crédito dos años  y le gusta por los beneficios adicionales que ofrece la institución. Sus sueños son tener su casa bien construida y salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
The communal bank "20 De Abril" meets once a fortnight in the Montecristo canton. The area is known for its rich precolonial culture and for its handicrafts which are renowned both nationally and internationally. It is the home of the famous Panama straw hats.

This is where Graciela lives. She is 30 years old and has a partner, with whom she has four children aged 12, 7, 4 and 3. The two older ones go to school. Her husband is a furniture maker.

Graciela is applying for the loan for her husband to use in his business. He has a furniture making workshop in his home. Here he does a lot of work in wood, making items such as chairs, doors, beds and other things. He works from Monday to Saturday from 8am to 5pm. He does work for customers who visit his workshop and also supplies some stores in the cities of Manta and Portoviejo. He buys the wood from a wood yard in Manta where he can find the wood he needs to do good quality work. 

They will use this loan to buy wood, paint, sealants and other materials for making his products. Graciela has been in the communal bank for two years and she likes it because of the additional benefits the institution offers. Her dreams are to have a well built house and to get on in life with her family.

loans.use: to buy wood, paint, sealants and other materials.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La Sra. Margarita tiene 51 años, proviene de una Familia de comerciantes ya que sus padres se dedicaban al comercio por ende ella les ayudaba.
Se animó y con la ayuda de su marido se independizo hace varios   años  en su propio negocio, comenta que le va muy bien en su local y que ya gano muy buena clientela. Comenta además que aprendió mucho donde estaba como comerciante con sus padres y a la par aprendió de cómo administrar y llevar adelante un negocio.
Ella pide de este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos varios para su despensa, como ser verduras, carne, bebidas, hortalizas y demás, y de esa forma poder seguir luchando por mejorar.
texts.en:
Doña Margarita, aged 51, is from a family of merchants and helped her parents run their shop. Several years ago, she became determined to go into business for herself, and with her husband's help, she opened her own shop. Doña Margarita reports that business at her shop is very good and she's built up a strong customer base. She also reflects that she learned a great deal from her parents, who taught her how to manage and grow a business. 

Doña Margarita is applying for a loan so that she can invest the funds in the purchase of various items to boost her inventory, such as vegetables, greens, meats, drinks, and other goods. A larger inventory will allow Doña Margarita to keep striving to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, greens, meats, drinks, and other goods.

loans.name: Ismael

texts.es:
Ismael es una persona muy trabajadora, que se esta esforzando por poder seguir trabajando y creciendo. Su préstamo anterior lo invirtió para el cambio de su vehículo, que le permitirá hacer su trabajo y cumplir con sus clientes.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la refracción de su casa, que le permitirá seguir ofreciendo a su familia una calidad de vida digna.
texts.en:
Ismael is a very hardworking man, who is always striving to keep working and getting ahead. His used the funds from his previous loan to purchase a new vehicle, which allows him to do his work and satisfy his customers. 

Ismael is applying for this loan to invest the funds in home repairs that will allow him to keep providing his family a decent quality of life.

loans.use: to make home repairs.

loans.name: Gulbarkan

texts.ru: Гулбаркан 54 года, замужем, воспитывают 4 детей. Гулбаркан имеет среднее образование, работает почтальоном в местном почтамте. Супруг работает в районной электростанции - контролером. Гулбаркан по характеру: спокойная, уравновешенная и трудолюбивая. Супруг и дети помогают по бизнесу. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, уже много лет занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Гулбаркан в хозяйстве имеется: 1 дойная корова 1 теленок, а также имеет земельный надел размером 1,5 ГА, на котором выращивает хлопок. Ее деятельность приносит около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. Доходы от хозяйства позволили Гулбаркан дать хорошее образование своим детям. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гулбаркан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку телят. Доходы от кредита Гулбаркан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства, а также, в будущем намерена произвести капитальный ремонт дома.
texts.en: Gulbarkan is 54 years old, married, with four children. Gulbarkan has a secondary education and works as a mail carrier at the local post office. Her husband works at the local power station as an inspector. Gulbarkan is a calm, self-possessed and hard-working person by nature. Her husband and children help her in her business. As an additional source of income for her family, Gulbarkan has been raising livestock and growing produce for many years, having launched this business with a starting capital of 10,000 KGS. Thanks to Gulbarkan’s hard work, her farm now includes one dairy cow an done calf, and a 1.5-ha [about 4 acres] land plot, where Gulbarkan grows cotton. Her business brings in about 10,000 KGS per month. In order to develop her business further, Gulbarkan turned to the Bai Tushum & Partners microfinance institution for a loan intended to buy calves. Gulbarkan plans to invest the resulting revenue in a further expansion of her farm. Also, in the future, she plans to do major renovations on her house.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.es: Jaqueline, habita en un barrio marginal de Managua en donde hay muchos conflictos vecinal y sobre todo delincuentes, ella es madre de dos hijos que son estudiantes de secundaria y primaria, Jaqueline labora vendiendo ropa, calzado, cosméticos por encargo, con sus ingresos y el apoyo de su esposo mantiene sus  gastos principales del hogar y la de sus hijos. Solicita el crédito para comprar materiales de construcción para empezar a hacer con esta primer etapa de crédito el muro frontal de su casa, esto para garantizar la seguridad de sus hijos.
texts.en: Jaqueline lives in a marginal Managua neighborhood where there are many conflicts among neighbors and between all the criminal elements.  She is the mother of two children who attend middle and elementary school.  Jaqueline works selling clothing, shoes, and cosmetics to order and she and her husband pay the main household and childcare expenses.  She is asking for this loan to buy building materials to begin the first phase of building a wall in front of her house.  This will guarantee her children's safety.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well-known market areas in Montserrado County. She is 39 years old and single with five children between 16 and 26 years old. Hawa’s five children live at home and three attend high school while the older ones attend college. For eight years she has been selling charcoal in her community market. Lower income is the problem she faces now. But she enjoys the interaction with her customers and the profit she generates every day. 

Hawa is requesting a loan to buy charcoal to sell. This will be her fourth loan. Hawa’s dream is to have a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell

loans.name: Bendu

texts.en:
Bendu lives in West Point, which is one of the most populated and well-known areas in Montserrado County, Liberia. She is 27 years old, lives in her parents’ house, and has a 4-month-old child who is looked after by her mother. For the past four years Bendu has been selling used clothes and making local soap. She is busy working eight hours on her business and this makes her proud, just like those who work in bank offices. Bendu enjoys the interaction with her customers and making a profit. 

Bendu is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes, caustic soda, oil, and wood for her businesses. This will be her fifth loan. Bendu’s plan is to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase used clothes, caustic soda, oil, and wood for her businesses

loans.name: Rostand

texts.en:
Rostand is a 31-year-old single Cameroonian without a child. For the past year, he has sold used shoes in the market. Rostand’s business is located in an urban area with many potential customers. 

Rostand is requesting a loan to buy used shoes to resell. His loan will increase his profit by seventeen percent. Rostand hopes to also improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy used shoes to resell

loans.name: Bendu

texts.en:
This is Bendu, who lives in West Point in Montserrado County, a well-known commercial city in Liberia. She is 30 years old and married with a 2-year-old child who lives at home. For the past two years, Bendu has been selling rice by the cup at the local market. She started this business with the help of her husband and she learned this way of selling from her mother. Bendu sells for 12 hours each day and most often uses a taxi to get her stock at her shop. She enjoys the flows of customers. 

Bendu is requesting a loan to buy more rice to increase her sales. In the future, she wants to get more money to educate her child and build a house. Bendu appreciates Kiva for its continued support.

loans.use: to buy more rice to sell

loans.name: Doris' Group

texts.en:
Doris is in her late 40's and is married with two children who are still in school. She has been running a clothing and provisions business for 8 years. She works from 7:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. every working day and is able to make a very good monthly profit. Doris is doing great with her business and family.

This will be her sixth loan request from ID-Ghana and second with Kiva. With her previous loans, all of which were paid back successfully, Doris used the funds to buy clothing and provisions. She is happy with ID-Ghana products because they are so convenient. With this loan, Doris will buy more clothing and provisions. She dreams that one day she will be able to build a house. 

Doris will take this loan with her loan group, members totaling 5. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying back the loan amount of 4,900 GHS.

loans.use: To buy more clothing and provisions

loans.name: Shek            Fuad

texts.en:
Meet 45-year-old Shek from Waterloo Western rural area in Freetown. He is married with 6 children. His children are currently attending school. For the past 20 years, Shek has established his plastic materials business. He began his business because he did not go to school, so he has to run this business to create a source of income. He works at the business from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm, 7 days per week. He says that the main challenges to his business are price inflation and that transporting his goods from town to Waterloo is very difficult.     

Shek requires a loan in order to buy more rubber cups, buckets and a variety of food containers. He hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow him to educate his children and increase his business. In the future, Shek plans to import his goods from a neighboring country. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more rubber cups, buckets and a variety of food containers.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia, 48 years of age, is married to a farmer and blessed with five children. Leticia has owned and managed a retail store in their village for almost three years, earning a net income of PHP 1,000 daily which she spends on school allowances for their children. 

Due to lack of capital Leticia is requesting a loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase noodles, canned goods, beverages, coffee, sugar, and cooking oil to sell. She hopes that her request will be granted so that her store can be improved.

loans.use: To purchase noodles, canned goods, beverages, coffee, sugar, and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Safarali

texts.ru: Сафарали работает фермером. Ему 64 года. Он живет в городе Куляб с женой, тремя сыновьями и невесткой. Сафарали занимается растениеводством в течение 10 лет. Он научился выращивать сельскохозяйственную культуру у своего соседа, у которого есть дехканское хозяйство. Сафарали нравится его работа. Он обеспечивает свою семью не только доходом, но и свежими и экологически чистыми овощами. Ему в посеве и сборе урожая помогают сын и жена. Сафарали в данный момент проводит озимый посев. Он берет кредит для купли семян картофеля и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Safarali is a farmer. He is 64 years old. He lives in the city of Kulob with his wife, three sons and daughter. Safarali has worked in agriculture for ten years. He learned how to grow crops from his neighbor who has a private farm. Safarali loves his job. Not only does it provide the family's income, but also fresh organic vegetables. His son and wife help him sow and harvest. Safarali is currently sowing a winter crop. He is taking out a loan to buy seed potatoes and fertilizer.

loans.use: buy seed potatoes and fertilizer.

loans.name: Dan

texts.en:
Dan was born in 1993 in a family which has 6 members. He has one sister. His parents are builders. His family income is about VND 6,000,000. After Dan graduates, he will be the first person in his family who has a bachelor's degree. Both his mother and his father have not finished secondary education. 

Dan is studying at Hanoi University of Science and Techonology (http://www.hust.edu.vn/web/vi/home). His main focus is Electronic Automation. Dan believes that this major is totally suitable to his strengths and also his passions. Dan hopes that when he completes his studies, he will be able to find  jobs that match with his study field and generate more income for his family.
 
Dan is requesting a loan of VND 14,076,000 to pay for tuition and to buy a new computer which is very crucial to his studies. Through this program, Dan would like to say thank you to every donor all around the world. He wishes that more students would be provided opportunities to follow their dream like he is.

loans.use: to pay for tuition and to buy a new computer.

loans.name: Son

texts.en:
Son was born in 1994. She is studying at Water Resources University (http://en.wru.edu.vn/ ). Her major is Economy and Administrator. Son is requesting a loan of VND 10,710,000 to pay for her tuition. 

Son’s family has five members. She has one brother and one sister. Her mother sells chickens and ducks in the local market. Her father is a carpenter. Her family income is about VND 5,000,000. Son will be the first person in her family who has a bachelor's degree. Besides the desire to bring more income to her family, she wants to encourage her brother and sister to follow her success.

Through this program, Son would like to say thanks to every donor all around the world. She wishes that more students would be provided opportunities to follow their dream like she has.

loans.use: to pay for tuition.

loans.name: Chang

texts.en:
Chang was born in 1993 in a family of 4 members. She has one younger brother who is an undergraduate student. Her mother runs a small grocery store. His father is a fisherman. Her family income is about VND 7,500,000 per month. 

Chang is curently studying at Banking Academy (http://eng.hvnh.edu.vn/ ). She also works part-time at a clothing store with a monthly salary of VND 3,000,000. Chang is requesting a loan of VND 15,300,000 to pay for her tuition and to buy a new computer. Chang expects that with the money borrowed she can work less hours per week and pay more attention to her studies. 

Through this program, Chang would like to say thanks to every donor all around the world. She wishes that more students would be provided opportunities to follow their dream like she has.

loans.use: to pay for tuition and to buy a new computer.

loans.name: Gam

texts.en:
Gam was born in 1994. She is studying at Hanoi College of Commerce and Tourism (http://www.hcct.edu.vn/ ). Her main focus is Hospitality Management. Gam expects that she will graduate in September 2015. 

Gam’s family has 4 members. Her mother is a fisherman. Her father is a builder. Her younger brother is also in college. With a monthly income of VND 6,500,000, her parents cannot provide for both of their children. As a result, they have to borrow from their relatives to pay for her tuition. She would like to borrow VND 10,710,000 to pay for tuition and to buy education equipment. 

Gam really appreciates that she can participate in this program. She would like to thank all donors around the world who have contributed to this program. This has supported her education a lot and Vietnamese’s youth generation in general.

loans.use: to pay for tuition and to buy education equipment.

loans.name: Raúl Alexander

texts.es:
Raúl es residente de un municipio del oriente antioqueño, donde se radicó hace varios años con el ánimo de iniciar su propia producción agrícola, es antropólogo y ha participado en diversos proyectos y asesorías para agricultores y desplazados en la región, razón por la que se enamoró de esta actividad y que hoy en día le genera recursos para el sostenimiento propio y el de su pequeño hijo de 1 año de edad. A sus 33 años, posee cultivos orgánicos de orellanas y además tiene una huerta en donde siembra maíz, acelgas, cebolla, coles, lechuga y algunas plantas medicinales; estos productos los comercializa en la plaza de mercado y en algunas tiendas orgánicas de la ciudad cercana al municipio.
Se motiva a solicitar el apoyo del crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la construcción de un invernadero, comprar estufas y medidores de humedad y temperatura, canecas plásticas y empaques, realizar mejoras locativas y realizar mantenimiento al medio de transporte, esto le permitirá continuar con su labor y tecnificar el proceso para aumentar la producción, con lo que podrá satisfacer la demanda y mejorar los ingresos.
Raúl tiene como meta lograr concientizar a las personas del daño que causan los químicos utilizados en la agricultura tradicional y crear cultura para comenzar a consumir productos orgánicos, además desea cumplir el sueño de adquirir su propia finca, que sea autosostenible, en la que pueda tener gran variedad de productos agrícolas limpios, para poder generar una mejor estabilidad económica y dar a su hijo un mejor bienestar y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Raúl is 33 and lives in a town in northwest Antioquia Department, where he settled several years ago in order to start up his own farm operation. Raúl is an anthropologist and has participated in a variety of projects and consulting services for farmers and displaced people in the area. He found he loved farming and now earns enough income to support himself and his one-year-old son. 

Raúl grows organic mushrooms and also has a plot where he grows corn, chard, cabbage, lettuce, and some medicinal plants. He sells these crops in a town market and at a few organic shops in a nearby city. 

Raúl is applying for a loan to meet multiple needs: the construction of a greenhouse; the purchase of heaters, temperature and humidity gauges, plastic bins and containers; to make improvements to his farm building; and to pay for vehicle maintenance. These investments will allow Raúl to continue his work and refine his operations in order to increase production, meet the demand for his crops, and boost his income. 

Raúl's goal is to raise awareness in his community about the harm that results from the use of chemicals in traditional agriculture. He wants to encourage people to start consuming organic produce. Raúl also wants to fulfill his ambition to acquire his own farm and ensure its sustainability. He wants to grow a wide variety of clean crops that will lead to greater financial stability and provide his son greater comfort and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in the construction of a greenhouse; the purchase of heaters and temperature and humidity gauges, plastic bins and containers; make improvements to his farm building; and pay for vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
Belen is a married woman with five children from Loon, Bohol. For the past ten years, she has raised hogs.

Belen is requesting a loan to buy pig feed and supplements to keep her pigs healthy. She will use her loan to improve her business, provide feed for her hogs, and boost their growth. Belen will use the profit from her loan for food, to pay household bills, and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and supplements

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a married woman with three children from the town of Antequera, Bohol. She has been engaged in weaving baskets for 16 years now to provide for her family. This is her main source of income. 

Gina is requesting a loan to buy materials such as "nito" (a native palm) for making baskets and to pay for transportation expenses. Her loan will help sustain her business and allow her to deliver on time. Gina will use the profit from her loan to provide food for her family and reinvest in her business. In the future, she hopes to expand and venture into other business opportunities.

loans.use: to buy nito and pay for transportation

loans.name: Mastonaoy

texts.ru: Мастонаой всегда старается для улучшения условия проживания. Она добрая и заботливая мать. Мастонаой имеет 3 несовершеннолетних детей. Ее муж производит пластиковые окна и двери. Мастонаой всегда хотела иметь собственный бизнес и помочь мужу по обеспечению семьи. Узнав о курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованного Ассоциация Деловых Женщин была очень рада и участвовала в нем. Теперь она уверена в себе, что может организовать свой бизнес. Она хочет организовать бизнес полотенца, покрывала, одеяло и т.п. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки товара. Она будет торговать на местном рынке, и с бизнесом будет справляться сама. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Mastonaoy is always trying to improve her living conditions. She is a kind and caring mother. Mastonaoy has three minor children. Her husband makes plastic windows and doors. Mastonaoy has always wanted to own her own business and help her husband feed the family. When she learned about the entrepreneurial course "Bring It," organized by the Association of Business Women, she was very happy and participated in it. Now she is confident that she can start her own business. She wants to start a business selling towels, bedspreads, blankets, etc. She is requesting a loan of 5000 Somoni to buy goods. She will trade at the local market and will take care of the business by herself. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: buy goods to start a new business

loans.name: G/s La Paz Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario la Paz está conformado por tres integrantes, madres solteras con siete hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarias de Jinotepe, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. Se caracterizan por ser trabajadoras, responsables con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudieron estudiar, a muy temprana edad decidieron trabajar para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. En la actualidad siguen luchando para brindarles a sus hijos mejores oportunidades.

Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es  Sonia y tiene por actividad económica la venta de ropa, cosméticos, y útiles escolares como: pantalones, short, faldas, camisas, rubor, crema hidratantes, perfumes, cuadernos, lápices, corrector, resaltador. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 8 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos, el negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación. El  objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos de cosméticos, ropa y útiles escolares, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El grupo solidario La Paz agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The La Paz Group is formed by three members, single mothers with seven children under their care. They are originally from Jinotepe, a place that is located in the northern part of Nicaragua. The women are known for being hardworking, responsible, and with strong desires to improve themselves. Unfortunately, due to the lack of economic resources, the women could not study, and at a very early age, decided to work to help with the expenses of the household. They are still struggling to provide their children with better opportunities. 

Because of her effort and desire to succeed, Sonia is the coordinator of the group. Her business is the sale of clothes, cosmetics, blush, moisturizers, perfumes, and school supplies such as pants, shorts, skirts, blouses, notebooks, pencils, white-out, and highlighters. She runs her business 8 hours a day selling products, and it is located in her home. The purpose of the loan is to invest in working capital and to stock the business with cosmetic products, clothes, and school supplies, so that Sonia can earn better income in the near future. The La Paz Group is grateful for the help that Kiva's investors offer to people with scarce resources in poor countries like Nicaragua, in order to for them to have a decent means of work.

loans.use: invest in working capital and stock the business with products such as pants, shorts, skirts, blouses, blush, lotions, perfumes, notebooks, pencils, white-out, and highlighters.

loans.name: Junkgirls, Llc Group

texts.en:
The Junk Girls was founded in 2009 and born out of a combination of Art Therapy for Jenny and Melissa’s love for all things handmade. After our 18+ years working in corporate that include Netflix and eBay, our vision is to put our collective skill sets together and do something meaningful that would make a difference for both us and others. We believe that everything has value, no matter how damaged it is, and we enjoy giving new life to things that might otherwise be overlooked or thrown away, which, as a metaphor, fits our lives perfectly. 

We are Social Entrepreneurs that work within the emerging new industrial revolution of Makers/Do It Yourself Micro-Manufacturing. Considered innovators by many, we are utilizing our background in art & design to create inventive ways to repurpose what some call junk into beautiful art, jewelry and home décor products, while enabling ourselves and others to heal during and by this process. 

The manufacturing of our metal stamped products is done 100% by hand. This is our number one area of growth, with our retailers requesting higher product volume than we can supply. By automating the process we can build product at least 4-5 times faster to meet the market demand.  A KIVA loan will help us with the first round of tools used in building the metal stamping automation process.

loans.use: To purchase the first round of tools used in building the metal stamping automation process and producing to meet market demand.

loans.name: Felecia

texts.en:
Felecia is 43 years old and lives in the town of West Point. She is married and has four children who live with her and attend school. For two years, Felecia has been selling oranges, bananas, and other fruit in the local market. She sells from morning through evening every day. Felecia has a regular group of customers that buy from her which makes her happy. Making her own money also impresses her. 

Felecia is requesting a loan to purchase more oranges, bananas, and other fruit for her business. In the future, she wants to own a house. Felecia thanks BRAC Liberia for their continuous supports.

loans.use: to purchase more oranges, bananas, and other fruit for her business

loans.name: Didie

texts.en:
Didie is a 41-year-old Cameroonian who is married with six children. Her oldest child is 19 and in secondary school and her youngest is seven and in primary school. For the past year, Didie has run a general store which has given her experience. Her business is likely to succeed because it is located in an urban area with many potential customers.

Didie is requesting a loan to buy stuff such as biscuits, powdered soup, rice, bread, bananas, and other items. Her loan will increase her profit by thirty percent and also improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy stuff such as biscuits, powdered soup, rice, bread, bananas, and other items

loans.name: Murtazo

texts.ru: Муртазо жизнерадостный и добродушный мужчина. Он женат и имеет троих детей. У него очень дружная семья. Живут они в сельской местности. Чтобы иметь доход в семье, Муртазо пытается как-то зарабатывать деньги. В свободное время Муртазо работает таксистом, у него есть собственная машина для этого. От этой работы он получает хороший доход. Но как основным бизнесом, Муртазо занимается животноводством. Он разводит и продаёт скот. В этом деле ему помогает жена. Она ухаживает за скотом, а также продаёт полученное от скота молоко. Бизнес животноводства приносит Муртазо хороший и стабильный доход. Поэтому он желает расширить этот бизнес. Ему необходимо купить ещё несколько голов скота для выращивания и дальнейшей продажи. Для этого Муртазо обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку скота. Он надеется, что этот бизнес будет успешно расширяться и приносить больше прибыли, чтобы качественно удовлетворять нужды семьи. Муртазо заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en: Murtazo is a cheerful and good-natured man. He is married and has three children. He has a very close-knit family. They live in the countryside. Murtazo is trying to somehow make money so his family can have an income. In his spare time, he works as a taxi driver. Murtazo uses his own car for this. He earns a decent income from driving. But his primary source of income is animal husbandry. He breeds and sells livestock. In this case, he helps his wife. She cares for the cattle and also sells milk. Murtazo's livestock business brings in a good and stable income, so he wants to expand the business. He needs to buy a few head of cattle for breeding and resale. Murtazo approached Arvand for a loan to buy cattle. He hopes that this business will successfully expand and bring in more money, to better meet his family's financial needs. Murtazo thanks Arvand in advance for its support.

loans.use: buy cattle

loans.name: Bazarsad

texts.en:
Bazarsad, 40 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Kherlen, the easternmost town of Mongolia. He has been working as driver at a private firm since 2004. His wife has a position in the nursery at the surgery department of the hospital. Their elder son is graduating from university this summer and is  studying technology. The younger son goes to high school. 

Bazarsad is requesting a loan of 1,800,000 MNT to pay for his son's university tuition fee. He thinks this is the best investment he can make for his son because after graduating his university, his son can open opportunities for himself.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fee.

loans.name: Yon

texts.en:
Yon, 49 years old, lives in a village about 35 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has four children. One is married, two are garment workers and another one works for a company that produces drinking water. 

Yon is a farmer. She grows rice on her farmland of 0.80 hectar. She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her rice farm and to pay for plowing fees. 

Yon is pictured at home, not at her farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her rice farm.

loans.name: Vanry

texts.en: Vanry (pictured here) is 39 years old. She lives in the suburb of Phnom Penh City. She has two children who are in school. Her husband is a moto kangbei taxi driver. In the past, they were commonly known as "tuk tuks" (a three wheeled motorcycle taxi), but they are now officially called "moto kangbei" by government authorities. Vanry is a cleaner for a school. She needs money pay for her house building fees because she has successfully built her house, but she has not paid for it yet. So, she asks for the loan to pay for building fees.
